oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Tennessee General Claim filed by William Mitchell, agent of David Bales
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Four-page form in which William Mitchell, agent of David Bales, files claim for ten bushels of corn taken by the 9th Michigan Regiment in October 1865 for use by the Federal Army. The initial filing occurred April 22, 1868. Also contained in the form are affidavits, certifications by U.S. and county officials, and the approval signature of Governor Brownlow.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Tennessee General Claims Commission
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Tennessee General Assembly formed the General Claims Commission February 19, 1868, to compensate loyal citizens who suffered property losses at the hands of Union or Confederate forces and to pay unpaid wages. The Commission operated through county claims commissioners and were to present the claims to the U.S. Government; however, the claims were recorded but not paid. Wartime claims would be both recorded and paid through the Southern Claims Commission, formed in 1871.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Civil War in the West; Civil War society; United States - History - 1783-1865; United States - History - 1849-1877; United States History - Civil War, 1861-1865
Civil Wars; War
